Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AP-64 (AMP with 64 aa, C5orf46, natural AMPs, human, primates, mammals, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (30.3%) toTroTbeta4D: 17%, K: 13%, S: 11%. GRAVY: -1.13; Mol Wt: 7215.94; mol formula: C315H490N80O108S2; mol ex coeff: 0. Poor similarity to known AMPs.Activity:  active against E. coli DH5alpha or O157:H7 (MIC 3.6 ug/ml), V. cholerae (MIC 37.4 ug/ml), and P. aeruginosa (MIC 66.24 ug/ml), but not S.aureus and L.monocytogenes.Also exhibited cytotoxic effects against human T-cell lymphoma Jurkat and B-cell lymphoma Raji cells.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: expressed as SUMO fusion and His-tag purified.
Literature Information.Author: Zhong K, Wang Y, Wang Z, Zhang Z, Zhao S, Li H, Huang J, Guo W, Zheng X, Guo G, Zhou L, Yang H, Tong A. 2021
Literature Information.Title: AP-64, Encoded by C5orf46, Exhibits Antimicrobial Activity against Gram-Negative Bacteria.
